description.narrative: The Embassy of Kingdom of the Netherlands (EKN) in Kigali has set a clear target to transform the bilateral relationship moving from aid towards trade. This decision resonates the national development strategy of the Rwandan government aiming to halt inflows of development aid. Building on established ties, there is scope to further strengthen Rwandan-Dutch relations through a program that fuels economic cooperation between the two countries. The key objective of this program is to support Dutch companies in Rwanda and contribute to sustainable private sector development through the management of a transition fund.

title.narrative: Annual plan TRAIDE published on October 31, 2019

description.narrative: Enhancement investments by private actors and donor in Rwanda

title.narrative: Amount of private (co)-investment and donor investments

description.narrative: Amount of private (co)-investment and donor investments

comment.narrative: The estimated baseline for invested capital is >461.2 million euros. Investments were only reported by twelve out of twenty-two companies. It is considered confidential information and hence, the actual number will likely be higher. It includes the support provided by financial institutions (like FMO) and donors (like the Netherlands Embassy).
One new Dutch investor has come to Rwanda.

description.narrative: Improved access of Dutch businesses to information regarding Rwandan business climate and investment opportunities

Business opportunity reports will be written to improve the availability and accuracy of market information for Dutch businesses. Also, additional documents may be published to provide Dutch investors with additional information.

comment.narrative: No TRAIDE publications existed prior to the start of the program.
Ten reports were published by the TRAIDE team.

description.narrative: Imroved labour conditions for Rwandan employees thanks to Dutch companies
Number of employees with improved labor conditions working at Dutch companies in Rwanda

dimension.name: Number of employees with improved labor conditions

comment.narrative: The number of direct employees employed by businesses that apply the mentioned labor conditions is 456. The fact that certain employees did not mention specific labor conditions does not mean they do not apply them. Hence, the total number of direct employees with improved labor conditions is very likely to be higher than the one indicated.
No specific CSI support was provided to companies to enhance this number.

description.narrative: Increased employment opportunities in Rwanda thanks to Dutch companies
Number of jobs supported

comment.narrative: The total number of jobs supported reported by 15 interviewees is 1203. However, the answer was only provided by 15 out of 22 companies and hence, it will likely be higher.
One company went bankrupt in 2020.

Six links were established between Dutch and local companies.

description.narrative: Support and improved planning for investment, trade or service provision

title.narrative: Number of companies with a supported plan to invest, trade or provide services

description.narrative: Number of companies with a supported plan to invest, trade or provide services

comment.narrative: There are currently two Dutch businesses with a supported plan to invest: NOTS Solar lamps and People Pension Fund. Therefore, the baseline for the number of Dutch companies with a supported plan to invest, trade or provide services is 2.
Four companies have plans to invest in Rwanda.
